QuestionStem: Explore the image to learn more about the states of water.

content.imageAlt: In this photograph the snow-capped mountains in Antarctica appear against a bright blue sky with white, fluffy clouds. The mountains are reflected in the clear blue water. In this image, the three states of water appear.

panels.title: Liquid
panels.description: Most of Earth’s water is liquid. Gravity causes liquid water to flow downhill and rest in low-lying areas. As a result, Earth has rivers, lakes, and oceans.

panels.title: Gas
panels.description: Most water vapor is in Earth’s atmosphere. We cannot see water vapor, but our bodies take it in every time we inhale.

panels.title: Solid
panels.description: Solid water forms ice crystals, snowflakes, and hail in Earth’s atmosphere and ice and snow on Earth’s surface.
